study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the role and research status of Chlorin e6 (Ce6) in tumor therapy, particularly its applications in photodynamic therapy (PDT), sonodynamic therapy (SDT), and combined acoustic and light therapy.
results_summary: The study found that Ce6 is a highly effective photosensitizer and sonosensitizer with promising applications in tumor therapy, including PDT and SDT, though clinical challenges remain. It also highlighted potential uses in fluorescence navigation, antibacterials, and plant growth regulation.
population_specificity: Not specified (review of existing research on Ce6 in tumor therapy).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of high-frequency rTMS at different intensities versus conventional pelvic floor rehabilitation (including light therapy) on chronic pelvic pain syndrome (CPPS) in women.
results_summary: The abstract does not report specific results for light therapy, as it is part of the control group's conventional treatment and the study focuses on comparing rTMS interventions.
population_specificity: 63 female participants with chronic pelvic pain syndrome (CPPS).
study_duration: 10-day course for the control group (including light therapy).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the benefits and harms of non-pharmacological interventions, including light therapy, on sleep disturbances in people with dementia.
results_summary: The study found very low-certainty evidence regarding the effects of light therapy on sleep-related outcomes, with no conclusive benefits demonstrated. Only a few adverse events were reported in intervention groups, but data was limited.
population_specificity: People with dementia and sleep problems, primarily in nursing homes (14 studies), community residents (3 studies), and other settings (2 studies).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of light therapy as a nonpharmacological treatment option for sleep disorders in older adults.
results_summary: The abstract suggests that light therapy is one of several nonpharmacological interventions for managing chronic insomnia and other sleep disorders, but it does not provide specific efficacy data for light therapy alone.
population_specificity: Older adults with sleep disorders such as chronic insomnia, circadian rhythm sleep-wake disorders, and sleep-related movement disorders.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the safety and efficacy of low-level light therapy (LLLT) and intense pulsed light (IPL) for treating meibomian gland dysfunction (MGD).
results_summary: Both LLLT and IPL were safe and effective in improving ocular discomfort symptoms in MGD patients, with LLLT showing significantly greater improvement in symptoms and tear volume. No adverse events were reported in either group.
population_specificity: 40 eyes of 40 patients with meibomian gland dysfunction (MGD).
effective_dosage: Four weekly sessions of LLLT (MY MASK-E) or IPL (Eye-light device).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether combined wake and light therapy differentially improves mood in pregnant versus postpartum depressed participants by altering melatonin and sleep timing.
results_summary: Mood improved more with phase-delay intervention (PDI) in pregnant depressed participants and more with phase-advance intervention (PAI) in postpartum depressed participants. Two weeks of light treatment was as effective as six weeks, and mood improvement correlated with melatonin phase shifts in postpartum participants.
population_specificity: Pregnant (n=37) and postpartum (n=52) women, including depressed participants and normal controls.
effective_dosage: 60 minutes of bright white light daily (evening for PDI, morning for PAI).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate whether infrared photobiomodulation with low-level laser therapy (PBM) could reduce tooth sensitivity caused by in-office bleaching.
results_summary: The study compared PBM application after bleaching sessions against a simulated laser control group, using 3 J of energy and a dose of 100 J/cm². Results suggested PBM may help reduce bleaching-induced tooth sensitivity, though full statistical outcomes were not detailed in the abstract.
population_specificity: 83 participants undergoing in-office tooth bleaching.
effective_dosage: 3 J of energy, 100 J/cm² per session.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the potential benefits of 1072 NIR light therapy for male patients, based on its deeper penetration and biological properties.
results_summary: The abstract suggests that 1072 NIR light therapy may offer unique benefits for male patients due to its ability to penetrate deeper into the skin, but clinical research is limited and primarily focused on infections and photorejuvenation in females. The therapy holds potential as an accessible and affordable treatment option.
population_specificity: Male patients (theoretical application; current research primarily focused on females).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of photobiomodulation therapy (PTB) applied at pain points versus pre-established points in women with painful temporomandibular disorders (TMD).
results_summary: PTB applied at pain points was more effective than at pre-established points, with better outcomes regardless of dose (4 J or 6 J). The 6 J dose showed a trend toward better results, and individualized protocols based on palpation were recommended.
population_specificity: 54 women aged 18-60 with painful TMD, diagnosed using DC/TMD.
effective_dosage: 4 J and 6 J, divided into pre-established points (PE) and pain points (PD), applied once per week.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of intense pulse light (IPL) combined with low-level light therapy (LLLT) in improving symptoms and signs of dry eye disease (DED), particularly those related to meibomian gland dysfunction (MGD).
results_summary: The study found significant improvements in OSDI scores, tear film stability, and meibomian gland function, but no changes in tear volume or Schirmer test results. Contradictory outcomes were noted for tear osmolarity and corneal fluorescein staining.
population_specificity: Patients with dry eye disease due to meibomian gland dysfunction.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine and summarize current evidence on the efficacy of light therapy for improving sleep in older people living in long-term care settings.
results_summary: Light therapy with varying durations and intensities (short-term high light, moderate-term moderate light, or long-term low light) was associated with improved sleep indicators in older adults in long-term care. The efficacy may depend on exposure duration, timing, light intensity, and equipment used.
population_specificity: Older people living in residential long-term care settings.
effective_dosage: Typically administered between 7:00 and 12:00 am for 30-120 minutes, with intensities ranging from 2500 to 10,000 lux.
study_duration: Interventions lasted from 1 week to several months.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy, mechanisms, and challenges of transcranial near-infrared laser therapy as a potential treatment for acute stroke.
results_summary: The study found that light therapy did not demonstrate efficacy in human stroke patients based on the NEST trials, but highlighted lingering questions regarding mechanisms, dosages, safety, and patient selection criteria.
population_specificity: Human stroke patients.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to provide a comprehensive overview of the efficacy of bright light therapy (BLT) across various mental and behavioral illnesses by analyzing systematic reviews of randomized controlled trials.
results_summary: The study found that BLT outperformed light-related control conditions for seasonal and non-seasonal depression, but efficacy was not supported for other disorders due to limited RCTs. Higher quality systematic reviews are needed to strengthen confidence in these findings.
population_specificity: Individuals with mental and behavioral illnesses, including mood, neurocognitive, sleep, and eating disorders.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of long-haul travel on elite athletes' recovery and performance, excluding studies involving light therapy or pharmacological interventions.
results_summary: The study did not assess light therapy, as it was excluded from the systematic review. The focus was on the impact of long-haul travel on elite athletes, which showed perceived jet lag and physiological disturbances but inconclusive effects on performance.
population_specificity: Elite athletes from 6 sports who undertook long-haul flights (>6 hours).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of far-infrared emitting fabric (FIR) on neuromuscular performance of knee extensors over 120 hours and its impact on semen quality in healthy, resistance-trained males.
results_summary: FIR significantly improved neuromuscular performance (total work and pre-MVC) at 96 and 120 hours compared to placebo but did not affect conventional semen parameters or sperm DNA fragmentation.
population_specificity: Healthy, resistance-trained males (ages 28.8 ± 4.7 and 29 ± 3.9 years).
effective_dosage: Not specified (five consecutive days of use).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy of bright light therapy (BLT) augmentation compared to placebo light in treating non-seasonal major depressive disorder in patients already on stable antidepressant regimens.
results_summary: The study assessed outcomes using standardized depression rating scales at weeks 1, 2, and 4, but the abstract does not provide specific results regarding the effectiveness of BLT compared to placebo.
population_specificity: Outpatients with non-seasonal major depressive disorder in a subtropical area (24.5°-25.5°N), aged 22-81 years, on stable antidepressant dosages for 4 weeks prior to enrollment.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy of repeated low-level red light (RLRL) therapy versus 0.01% atropine eye drops for controlling myopia progression in children.
results_summary: RLRL therapy was significantly more effective than 0.01% atropine in slowing axial elongation and myopia progression, with a mean difference in axial length change of -0.24 mm and a mean difference in spherical equivalent refraction change of 0.57 D over 12 months.
population_specificity: Children aged 7 to 15 years with cycloplegic spherical equivalent refraction ≤ -1.00 diopter and astigmatism ≤ 2.50 diopters.
effective_dosage: RLRL treatment was provided by a desktop device emitting 650-nm red light (specific dosage/frequency not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the synergistic effect of blue light therapy combined with metronidazole delivered via needle-free jet injection (NFJI) in treating moderate and moderate-to-severe facial acne vulgaris.
results_summary: The combination of MNZ by NFJI and blue light showed significant improvements in acne lesion count reduction, skin barrier parameters (TEWL, hydration, sebum, erythema), and was more effective than either treatment alone. The method demonstrated good safety with no statistically significant adverse effects on pigmentation.
population_specificity: 251 patients with moderate and moderate-to-severe facial acne vulgaris.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy and acceptability of blue-wavelength light therapy (BWLT) versus long-wavelength/no light therapy (LW/NLT) for treating post-TBI sleepiness, sleep disturbance, depressive symptoms, and fatigue.
results_summary: BWLT was significantly superior to LW/NLT in reducing sleep disturbance and depressive symptoms, with trends suggesting benefits for sleepiness and fatigue. All-cause dropout rates did not differ between groups, indicating good acceptability.
population_specificity: Individuals with mild to severe traumatic brain injury (TBI).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effect of 940 nm low-level diode laser therapy on pain, edema, and trismus following surgical extraction of impacted mandibular third molars.
results_summary: The laser group showed significantly lower pain scores and reduced analgesic use compared to the control group, but no significant differences were observed for edema or trismus.
population_specificity: 25 patients with bilaterally impacted mandibular third molars.
effective_dosage: 940 nm diode laser irradiation (0.5 W, 10 J/cm²).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety and efficacy of blue light therapy in dermatology, focusing on its effects on skin pigmentation, DNA damage, and other histological markers.
results_summary: The study concluded that blue light therapy is safe for human skin and induces skin pigmentation, potentially mediated by photoreceptor Opsin-3, which may offer photoprotection against ultraviolet irradiation. Future research is needed to clarify photochemical reactions and optimal treatment parameters.
population_specificity: Human subjects with skin biopsies (specific demographics not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the potential of various energy-based therapies, including light therapy, to stimulate neuronal regeneration and functional recovery in CNS, PNS, and ocular disorders.
results_summary: The study found that light therapy, among other energy-based treatments, demonstrated efficacy in promoting neuronal differentiation, axonal regeneration, and functional recovery in animal models and humans with CNS, PNS, and ocular disorders. It also highlighted benefits such as retinal ganglion cell rejuvenation and remyelination.
population_specificity: Animal models and humans with CNS, PNS, retinal, and optic nerve disorders.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to systematically review the use of Photobiomodulation Therapy (PBMT) for treating mood disorders, identifying effective parameters, evidence levels, and practical recommendations.
results_summary: The study identified 16 relevant studies, including four RCTs, suggesting PBMT may be effective for mood disorders, with infrared wavelengths (800-830 nm) and power density of 250 mW/cm² as useful parameters. The evidence level and practical recommendation were assessed but not detailed in the abstract.
population_specificity: Human or animal studies (specific population not detailed in abstract).
effective_dosage: Infrared wavelength 800-830 nm, power density 250 mW/cm² (frequency not specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify and map evidence on nonpharmacological interventions, including Light Therapy, for acute pain management in patients with opioid tolerance or abuse.
results_summary: Light Therapy was briefly mentioned among various nonpharmacological interventions, but no specific results or detailed evidence regarding its effectiveness were provided. The review highlighted a lack of primary research and detailed evidence for many interventions, including Light Therapy.
population_specificity: Patients with opioid tolerance or opioid abuse experiencing acute pain in inpatient or outpatient healthcare settings.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the clinical effectiveness of intense pulsed light (IPL) therapy, alone or combined with meibomian gland expression (MGX), for treating dry eye disease caused by meibomian gland dysfunction (MGD).
results_summary: IPL therapy significantly improved multiple dry eye symptoms and metrics (e.g., OSDI, SPEED, TBUT) compared to sham treatment. IPL combined with MGX showed superior effects in some outcomes compared to MGX alone, though no significant differences were observed in others.
population_specificity: Patients with dry eye disease caused by meibomian gland dysfunction (1,142 patients, 2,284 eyes).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the association between symptoms and signs in patients with meibomian gland dysfunction (MGD) undergoing intense pulsed light therapy.
results_summary: The study found no correlation between symptoms (SPEED scores) and clinical signs (TBUT, CFSS, MGYSS, or eyelid margin abnormalities) in MGD patients. Age, menopause, and geographic region influenced eyelid margin abnormalities, but symptoms and signs remained poorly correlated even after adjusting for these factors.
population_specificity: 122 MGD patients recruited for intense pulsed light therapy from November 2017 to April 2018.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if timed light therapy could reverse disrupted circadian rhythms and glucose intolerance in rotating night shift workers.
results_summary: Light therapy had no impact on sleep, metabolic, or inflammatory parameters but caused significant changes in circadian clock gene expression (REV-ERBα and BMAL1) in peripheral blood mononuclear cells. These gene expression changes were temporary, reverting after the wash-out period.
population_specificity: Rotating night shift workers (13 in the experimental group, 9 in the control group).
effective_dosage: 10,000 lx at 35 cm for 30 minutes per day.
study_duration: 12 weeks of intervention followed by a 12-week wash-out period.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the feasibility and initial effectiveness of BROAD light therapy compared to standard light box therapy for Seasonal Affective Disorder (SAD).
results_summary: Both BROAD light therapy and standard light box therapy similarly and considerably improved SAD symptoms, with higher illuminance in BROAD therapy potentially linked to greater symptom improvement. No significant adverse effects were reported.
population_specificity: 62 patients with Seasonal Affective Disorder (SAD).
effective_dosage: BROAD light therapy: very brightly illuminated room for at least 6 hours per day; standard therapy: 30 minutes in front of a 10,000 lux light box.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of low-level laser therapy (LLLT) on myofascial neck pain (MNP) through a comprehensive meta-analysis of randomized controlled trials.
results_summary: The meta-analysis found that LLLT significantly reduced pain intensity and improved pain pressure threshold (PPT) and right bending range of motion (ROM), but did not significantly improve disability outcomes. The pooled results suggest LLLT may be effective for MNP when used alongside other therapies.
population_specificity: Patients with myofascial neck pain (556 participants across 13 RCTs).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy of bright light therapy (BLT) alone and in combination with cognitive behavioral therapy for insomnia (CBT-I) in improving sleep and fatigue symptoms in women undergoing chemotherapy for breast cancer.
results_summary: The study will evaluate the comparative and combined effects of BLT and CBT-I on insomnia, fatigue, and other secondary outcomes, but specific results are not yet reported in the abstract.
population_specificity: Women receiving cytotoxic chemotherapy for breast cancer at tertiary Australian hospitals.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential therapeutic effects of photobiomodulation (PBM) on chronic kidney disease (CKD) and summarize its underlying mechanisms.
results_summary: The study suggests PBM may mitigate mitochondrial dysfunction, oxidative stress, inflammation, and gut microbiota dysbiosis in CKD, indicating potential as a non-invasive therapy, though more research is needed.
population_specificity: Patients with chronic kidney disease (CKD).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of photobiomodulation with low-level laser therapy (LLLT) and nimesulide on inflammatory parameters, oxidative stress biomarkers, and quality of life following lower third molar surgery.
results_summary: LLLT significantly reduced pain scores after 4 and 6 hours, decreased edema and trismus, and improved quality of life perception. The combination of LLLT and nimesulide was not superior to LLLT alone.
population_specificity: 40 volunteers requiring bilateral lower third molar removal.
effective_dosage: Not specified for LLLT; nimesulide was 100 mg administered 1 hour before surgery.
study_duration: Not explicitly stated, but outcomes were measured up to 7 days post-surgery.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the impact of Tuina combined with blue light therapy on neonatal jaundice compared to blue light therapy alone.
results_summary: Tuina combined with blue light significantly improved treatment effectiveness, increased defecation frequency, reduced bilirubin levels, and decreased adverse events compared to blue light alone.
population_specificity: Neonates with jaundice.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to gather information on the use of polarized light (PL) for treating various wound types in animal and human studies.
results_summary: The study suggests that polarized light therapy (PLT) can stimulate wound healing similarly to low-energy lasers, with advantages such as lower cost, reduced hazards, and ease of use. However, practitioners remain skeptical about PL's effectiveness for musculoskeletal issues despite some supportive preclinical evidence.
population_specificity: Animal and human subjects with various wound types.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the efficacy of vitamin D in reducing depressive symptoms among adults in randomized placebo-controlled trials, excluding light therapy as an intervention.
results_summary: The abstract does not report results specific to light therapy, as it was an exclusionary criterion in the study. The focus was on vitamin D's effects on depressive symptoms.
population_specificity: Adults in general and clinical populations, including those with systemic diseases, but excluding individuals with bipolar disorder.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy and safety of combining low-dose oral isotretinoin with low-level light therapy (LLLT) using delicate pulsed light (DPL) for treating moderate-to-severe acne vulgaris.
results_summary: The study found that combining low-dose isotretinoin with DPL-based LLLT showed promising results in treating moderate-to-severe acne, though specific efficacy details were not fully outlined in the abstract. The abstract suggests LLLT may enhance anti-inflammatory effects and skin repair.
population_specificity: Thirty-six patients with moderate-to-severe acne vulgaris.
effective_dosage: DPL (6-9 J/cm²) and oral isotretinoin (10-20 mg/day).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of physical therapy and electrophysiotherapy treatments, including light therapy, for improving grip strength and reducing pain in patients with lateral epicondylitis.
results_summary: Light therapy showed statistically improved grip strength in a sensitivity analysis, though it was not significantly effective in the main analysis. The study concluded that electrophysiotherapy treatments, including light therapy, should be prioritized over physical therapy for improving grip strength.
population_specificity: Adults with lateral epicondylitis (mean age 47.4 ± 7.5 years; 53.1% women).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the application of photothermal therapy (PTT) using various nanoparticles for the treatment of breast cancer, focusing on improving effectiveness and reducing side effects compared to conventional treatments.
results_summary: The study found that PTT, particularly when combined with nanoparticles, enhances treatment effectiveness by targeting tumor tissue, increasing heat conversion efficiency, and reducing damage to healthy cells. Hybrid nanomaterials and ligand-targeted nanoparticles further improved specificity and efficacy.
population_specificity: Breast cancer patients (theoretical or preclinical focus, not explicitly stated).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize and evaluate the methodological and evidence quality of systematic reviews/meta-analyses on the effectiveness and safety of light therapy for non-seasonal depression.
results_summary: Light therapy was found to be effective as a non-pharmacological intervention for non-seasonal depression, but the evidence and methodological quality of the included studies were generally unsatisfactory, requiring cautious interpretation of results.
population_specificity: Individuals with non-seasonal depression.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of various treatments, including photochemical therapy (combined blue/red light), for mild-to-moderate and moderate-to-severe acne.
results_summary: Photochemical therapy (combined blue/red light) was found to be one of the most effective treatments for mild-to-moderate acne, with a mean difference of 35.36% in lesion reduction. For moderate-to-severe acne, photodynamic therapy (light therapy enhanced by a photosensitizing chemical) was also among the most effective treatments.
population_specificity: Individuals with mild-to-moderate and moderate-to-severe acne.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of evening light exposure (16:00-22:00) on circadian phase delays and work performance in shift workers.
results_summary: Evening light exposure produced phase delays in melatonin, body temperature, and sleep propensity; improved sleep quality, duration, memory, and work performance; had mixed effects on mood; and showed no changes in sleepiness or negative effects.
population_specificity: Shift workers or individuals undergoing simulated night shifts.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the uses of brimonidine in dermatology, including its effects on erythema related to rosacea, alcohol flushing syndrome, and light-based therapies.
results_summary: Topical brimonidine improved facial erythema in rosacea and reduced erythema associated with alcohol flushing syndrome, intense pulsed light therapy, and photodynamic therapy. It also served as a hemostatic agent in dermatosurgery, with some reported side effects like erythema, flushing, and burning.
population_specificity: Patients with dermatologic disorders, including rosacea, alcohol flushing syndrome, and those undergoing light-based therapies or dermatosurgery.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy and safety of biological non-pharmacological treatments, including Light Therapy, for mental disorders, focusing on standardized mean differences (SMD) and acceptability.
results_summary: Light Therapy showed a modest effect (SMD=0.41) for depressive disorders, with low certainty of evidence (GRADE=low). No significant differences in acceptability were noted compared to sham interventions.
population_specificity: Patients with depressive disorders.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether bright light therapy effectively reduces delirium in ICU patients as part of nonpharmacological interventions.
results_summary: Bright light therapy was found to be effective in reducing delirium incidence among ICU patients, as part of a broader analysis of nonpharmacological interventions. The meta-analysis showed significant effects on delirium outcomes, though specific details on light therapy's standalone efficacy were not isolated.
population_specificity: Critically ill patients in the intensive care unit (ICU).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the therapeutic potential of photobiomodulation (PBM) in improving outcomes for acute traumatic brain injury (TBI) by analyzing its antiapoptotic and anti-inflammatory effects.
results_summary: The systematic review and meta-analysis found that PBM showed promise in improving neurological severity scores (NSS) and reducing lesion size in animal models of TBI, based on 17 pre-clinical studies. The evidence suggests beneficial effects, though further research is needed to confirm clinical relevance.
population_specificity: Animal models of acute traumatic brain injury (TBI).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to discuss changes in circadian regulation of sleep with aging, the impact of age on circadian rhythm sleep disorders, and how neurologic diseases in older patients affect circadian rhythms and sleep.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific findings about Light Therapy's effects, focusing instead on general circadian rhythm sleep-wake disorders and their relation to aging and neurologic diseases.
population_specificity: Older patients and individuals with neurologic diseases.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the relationship between circadian rhythm dysregulation and diseases, and evaluate the potential of light therapy and chronobiotics as interventions.
results_summary: The study found evidence linking circadian rhythm dysregulation to disease origin/development and highlighted light therapy as a promising clinical intervention, though current research has limitations.
population_specificity: Not specified (general discussion of circadian-related diseases).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to establish a dose-response relationship between morning light treatment duration and reduction in amygdala reactivity among individuals with traumatic stress symptoms.
results_summary: The study found that morning light therapy may improve traumatic stress by reducing amygdala reactivity, with clinical assessments showing potential benefits for PTSD, depression, and anxiety symptoms. The results suggest a dose-dependent effect, though specific outcomes are pending completion of the trial.
population_specificity: Individuals with a history of DSM-5 criterion A trauma and traumatic stress symptoms (N=66).
effective_dosage: 15-minutes, 30-minutes, or 60-minutes of light treatment per day.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether low-level laser therapy (LLLT) compared to placebo accelerates bone neoformation in the midpalatal suture of patients undergoing transverse maxillary expansion.
results_summary: The study conducted a meta-analysis using standardized mean difference (SMD) and Cohen's d on random effects, but specific efficacy results are not detailed in the abstract. The methodology suggests rigorous analysis, but concrete outcome data is not provided.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing transverse maxillary expansion.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the mechanisms of combined brief cognitive behavioral therapy plus bright light therapy (CBT-I+Light) in improving sleep for women undergoing chemotherapy.
results_summary: The study found that behavioral mechanisms (e.g., time in bed awake, day-to-day out-of-bedtime variability) may be associated with sleep improvements, but cognitive mechanisms showed no significant difference between groups. The intervention's brevity may limit robust changes in target mechanisms.
population_specificity: Women receiving chemotherapy (N = 101).

study_goal: To determine the efficacy and safety of blue-light therapy in seasonal and non-seasonal major depressive disorder (MDD) by comparing it to active and inactive control conditions.
results_summary: The efficacy of blue-light therapy for treating seasonal and non-seasonal MDD remains unproven, with insufficient evidence to support its use. Future trials need longer durations, larger sample sizes, and better standardization of light therapy parameters.
population_specificity: Patients with seasonal and non-seasonal major depressive disorder (MDD).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether transcranial brain photobiomodulation (PBM) therapy targeting the frontal cortex could improve sleep and cognitive function in individuals with subjective cognitive decline (SCD).
results_summary: The study found no significant differences in sleep efficiency, REM stage percent, or wake-up time between the PBM and sham groups. However, the PBM group showed improved sleep efficiency and REM on the fifth day and performed better in cognitive tests (higher accuracy in 2-back and shorter reaction time in 1-back).
population_specificity: Fifty-eight individuals with subjective cognitive decline (SCD).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy and adverse effects of LED phototherapy versus conventional phototherapy in treating unconjugated hyperbilirubinemia in neonates.
results_summary: LED phototherapy showed a lower treatment failure rate and shorter duration compared to non-LED sources, with comparable bilirubin decline rates. Adverse effects included higher hypothermia risk but lower hyperthermia and skin rash risks with LED therapy.
population_specificity: Newborns (term and preterm) with unconjugated hyperbilirubinemia.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the feasibility and preliminary efficacy of morning bright light therapy to improve sleep in Veterans with mild traumatic brain injury (TBI).
results_summary: Post-intervention improvements were observed in self-reported insomnia, mood, and pain symptoms, as well as actigraphy-derived sleep measures and blood-based biomarkers related to inflammation. The protocol was well-adhered to and rated favorably by participants.
population_specificity: Veterans with a history of mild traumatic brain injury (TBI).
effective_dosage: ~10,000 lux at the eye for 60 minutes every morning.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop a multi-component sleep intervention for older persons with dementia, incorporating light therapy among other therapies, to manage sleep disturbances during the transition from hospital to home.
results_summary: Light therapy was identified as one of the effective therapies for managing sleep disturbances in persons with dementia, alongside physical activity therapy, sleep hygiene, and stimulus control therapy. These therapies were integrated into a multi-component intervention to be delivered using the teach-back technique.
population_specificity: Older persons with dementia experiencing sleep disturbances during the transition from hospital to home.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy and safety of bright light therapy (BLT) compared to placebo in treating perinatal depression (PND).
results_summary: BLT showed significantly higher response (75% vs. 18.2%) and remission rates (41.7% vs. 0%) compared to placebo, with no significant difference in treatment-related side effects between groups.
population_specificity: Pregnant or postpartum women (within the first year) diagnosed with major depressive disorder.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy and safety of a skin-adhesive low-level light therapy (LLLT) device for treating overactive bladder (OAB) caused by bladder muscle contraction.
results_summary: The LLLT group showed significant reductions in urge urinary incontinence (UUI) and urinary incontinence episodes compared to the sham group, with improved symptom scores (OABSS, UDI-6, IIQ-7) and no significant difference in adverse events between groups.
population_specificity: Patients with a clinical diagnosis of OAB treated at two university hospitals.
effective_dosage: Three times daily application of the LLLT device (Color DNA-WSF).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to confirm the efficacy, mechanisms, and biomarkers of Light Therapy (LT) for winter seasonal affective disorder (SAD) and compare its long-term outcomes with cognitive-behavioral therapy (CBT-SAD).
results_summary: The study found that LT and CBT-SAD had similar post-treatment outcomes, but CBT-SAD was associated with fewer depression recurrences two winters later. LT's efficacy was linked to circadian phase correction, while CBT-SAD's benefits were mediated by altering seasonal beliefs.
population_specificity: Adults with winter seasonal affective disorder (SAD).
study_duration: 6 weeks of initial treatment, with follow-ups in subsequent winters.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of low-level laser therapy (LLLT) with transcutaneous electrical nerve stimulation (TENS) and therapeutic ultrasound (US) in reducing pain and improving mouth opening in temporomandibular joint disorder (TMD) patients.
results_summary: LLLT was found to be more effective than TENS (95% CI) and therapeutic US (81% CI) in reducing pain and improving mouth opening in TMD patients. The meta-analysis included 9 RCTs, supporting LLLT's superior efficacy.
population_specificity: Temporomandibular joint disorder (TMD) patients

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effectiveness of low-level laser therapy (LLLT) on cognitive impairment and symptom severity in patients with chronic schizophrenia.
results_summary: The study found no significant improvement in cognitive impairment, positive/negative symptoms, or agitation/excitement levels after LLLT. A temporary reduction in depression/anxiety was observed after 6 sessions but did not persist after 2 months.
population_specificity: Male patients with chronic schizophrenia in a psychiatric hospital in Tehran, Iran.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether light therapy could suppress delirium in patients with Alzheimer's disease (AD).
results_summary: Light therapy significantly reduced delirium (measured by CAM scores) and improved behavioral symptoms (measured by NPI scores) in AD patients after 4 weeks. Caregiver burden (measured by ZBI scores) also decreased significantly in the treatment group.
population_specificity: Patients with Alzheimer's disease (AD).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate whether dynamic daylight (DDL) lighting could entrain and stabilize circadian rhythms in post-comatose patients with disorders of consciousness (DOC).
results_summary: The study found that DDL lighting improved circadian rhythm alignment to a 24-hour cycle, with 65% of patients showing closer period lengths to 24 hours. Additionally, rhythms were more pronounced, stable, and less variable under DDL compared to habitual lighting.
population_specificity: Post-comatose patients with disorders of consciousness (unresponsive wakefulness syndrome [n=15] and minimally conscious state [n=2]).
effective_dosage: Not specified (dynamic daylight lighting with higher illuminance and spectral changes).
study_duration: 7-8 days per condition (habitual light and dynamic daylight).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of dynamic bedroom lighting (DD-N lighting) on sleep and circadian rhythms in hospitalized patients with moderate to severe depression.
results_summary: Patients under DD-N lighting woke up earlier, slept longer, had higher sleep efficiency, and shorter nighttime awakenings. In the second week, sleep onset and the most active 10-hour period started earlier.
population_specificity: Hospitalized patients with moderate to severe depression.
effective_dosage: Not specified (dynamic bedroom lighting system with artificial dawn/dusk and blue-depleted nighttime lighting).
